issue.title: [CF 571] Since 5.0.4 - My 'Seal' check has stopped working
issue.body:
Used to alert to the absence of any one of the Paladin Seals, (similar Icon for 'Blessing' check remains unaffected.)
This worked fine prior to the latest patch, now it's 'state' has become unchanging insofar as the visibility of the Icon, which indicates the absence of the Seal, remains even when a Seal becomes active.  Icon export string at bottom.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Icon set up as above
2. Check that no Seal is active
3. Icon should disappear when one of the four seals is activated

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
Expectation of Icon becoming non-visible when seal active.
Instead, Icon is constantly visible.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
v6.0.2 but checked on r567 as well...

Do you have an error log of what happened?
No 'error' occurred

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)
Export string as follows:

^1^T^SShowTimer^B ^SOnlyMine^B ^SType^Sbuff ^SAlpha^N0 ^SName^SSeal~`of~`Insight;~`Seal~`of~`Justice;~`Seal~`of~`Righteousness;~`Seal~`of~`Truth ^SShowWhen^N1 ^SCustomTex^S20165 ^SShowTimerText^B ^SEvents^T ^SOnShow^T ^SSound^SBlizzard:~`Simon~`Ding ^t^t^SEnabled^B ^t^N60302^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

comments.body:
Seals aren't buffs anymore. They are stances.

You will have to use the stance condition, which has just been reinstated for seals in the latest alpha:

http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/files/

Edited Sep 1, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Many thanks, downloaded Alpha, changed to match condition Stance > Seal > True

Worked a treat. Thanks for the speedy response, keep up the good work!
